timeline.message:
fix BalanceFileParserTest failures and refactor balance parser

Signed-off-by: Xin Li <xin.li@swirlds.com>

catch SQLException from addBatch so executeBatch gets to run if any is added successfuly

Signed-off-by: Xin Li <xin.li@swirlds.com>

timeline.bodyText:
difference from previous implementation:
neither an empty line nor a malformed account balance line is considered as a failure. The file is verified, so we should try our best to process as much valid info as we can.
timeline.author: xin-hedera

timeline.bodyText: the logic of header parsing is preserved here: reading MAX_HEADER_ROWS for a a timestamp header and a column header.
timeline.author: xin-hedera

timeline.bodyText: followed IntelliJ idea suggestion, looks like it's unnecessary
timeline.author: xin-hedera

timeline.bodyText:
nit: an
i.e Reads 'an' account balance ...
timeline.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText:
q: Why create AccountBalanceItem instead of utilizing the AccountBalance domain entity?
They're almost the same except AccountBalance has realm and num broken out and here you are using the newer and preferred EntityId.
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText:
two reasons:

it parses a line from the csv file
it's a business layer domain object, not supposed to use an entity object here
replies.author: xin-hedera

replies.bodyText:
I would disagree with that. An entity object by its definition is a business layer domain object. The only place where it makes sense to create duplicates is for DTOs in the controller layer because you expose them to user.
As far as parsing from CSV, that could easily be moved to the reader class or it can live in the entity object as it's just a single, small method.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: will move the parsing logic into AccountBalance as it's easier to test than having the same logic in BalanceFileReader
replies.author: xin-hedera

replies.bodyText:
oh, there is a subtle difference between the two. AccountBalance does not have shard while AccountBalanceItem does.
It's not good to add shard into AccountBalance. Also because of the difference, BalanceFileReader.read should return a stream of AccountBalanceItem objects. Since we need a different class, it's natural to have the account balance line parsing implemented in the class itself. So this makes more sense now.
replies.author: xin-hedera

replies.bodyText: We don't need shard to be added to account balance. It's assumed that all entities in the system are for the same shard. You can just check if shard in csv doesn't equal mirrorProperties.getShard() then throw an error. Then can drop shard
replies.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: IMO, the reader should just worry about reading the csv file in its designated format and let the loader to decide which lines to drop / persist.
replies.author: xin-hedera

timeline.bodyText:
Should we consider using Repositories here instead of staying with PreparedStatements?
It should simplify the file logic.
Also if we utilize the AccountBalance entity object it'd be even smoother.
It's fine if the change would cause greater complexity and require significant refactoring but if it's centralized to mostly this file we should consider if it's in scope for this PR
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: performance is worse with Repositories. with batch turned on for CrudRepository, it takes 2~3 times the time (1.2s vs 400ms) to insert the rows from a sample csv file with ~24000 balance lines
replies.author: xin-hedera

replies.bodyText: There's way to optimize repositories to be equivalent to preparedstatements, but we can consider that later.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: Not closing the file. Should use try with resource to automatically close.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: will add logic to close the reader when the stream is closed. using try resource here will cause the reader closing before the stream is consumed, and the consumer will get an exception.
replies.author: xin-hedera

replies.bodyText: True, the try with resources should be for the Stream object since it's AutoCloseable and wraps the other readers.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: yup. I forgot to put the read() call into the try with resource block in loadAccountBalances. As discussed, I'll also add stream.onClose to close the reader in BalanceFileReaderImplV2.read
replies.author: xin-hedera

timeline.bodyText: Would be good to document here the fields within the line.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: Would be better to reuse accountId.entityIdToString()
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: We should just discard lines that are empty/blank instead of throwing NPE and catching it. We could have potentially have a blank line precede a valid timestamp and shouldn't error out.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: blank lines (empty string) should not cause optional.of to throw NPE. the only case here is readLine return null, i.e., EOF has reached. so we should catch that NPE since EOF has reached, and no timestamp header + column header combination is found.
replies.author: xin-hedera

timeline.bodyText: I'm not a fan of mocking lower level library classes like PreparedStatement, Connection and DataSource. It's brittle and causes the tests to break if we were to switch to repositories or pgcopy. Also, since this class directly writes to the database without repositories, this should test that the POJO gets properly mapped to the database. Currently it just verifies counts but not contents of messages so could miss mapping issues. Recommend it stay as an Integration test.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.message:
close reader when the stream closes, put stream in try with resource block

Signed-off-by: Xin Li <xin.li@swirlds.com>

remove AccountBalanceItem, move the parsing into AccountBalanceLineParser and use the domain class AccountBalance

update description and method name of AccountBalanceLineParserTest

Signed-off-by: Xin Li <xin.li@swirlds.com>

optimization for better balance file parsing performance and add performance test

Signed-off-by: Xin Li <xin.li@swirlds.com>

timeline.bodyText: nit: You can just chain this, no need to store stream in a variable first.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: The warmup file should be processed in the before method so it doesn't count towards the timeout.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.message:
chain the method calls on stream

Signed-off-by: Xin Li <xin.li@swirlds.com>
